result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle C. Darnell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- $268.00 court costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment.
- $250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

- Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

DNA Submission Acknowledgment Form

Attorney Benjamin James Webster appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kyle C. Darnell appeared by video means with Attorney Andrew T Knaak.  Alissa Morine appeared by video means from Dept of Corrections.  BJM-clerk  2:00 pm  CT questions Def re remote appearances.  Def waives right to be in person & wishes to proceed today remotely.  ADA Webster provides recommendation.  Atty Knaak notes errors/corrections to PSI & provides recommendation.  ADA Webster - extradition cost was paid in full in 11/2020.  

SENTENCE:  $250.00 DNA surchg, DNA sample, fel court costs, set up PP w/COCC's office.  2:25 pm adj.
Sentencing hearing on March 19, 2021 at 02:00 pm.
to Judge Waterman from atty Knaak requesting adjournment of Sentencing Hearing today
Def's NOH re MH on 11/18/20 - Return to Sender.  Not Deliverable as Addressed.  Unable to Forward.
Sentencing hearing on February 5, 2021 at 03:00 pm.

03:29 PM Attorney Andrew T Knaak appeared by video means for Defendant Kyle C. Darnell. Prosecuting Atty Benjamin James Webster appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Benjamin James Webster appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Defendant Kyle C. Darnell appeared by phone means.  JP-clerk by phone.  Ct - reviewed motion - Per ADA basis for withdrawing DJOC is due to fee of $1,660 in transfer fee's not being paid.  Per ADA Webster, DE has been making pymts, but still wants to proceed.  Per Atty Knaak, DE thought pymts were coming out of prison wages.  ADA Webster addresses ct. Atty Knaak addresses Ct.  DE is employed and can get it paid off.  Ct - based on offer of proof and the facts are not contested Ct - will grant request and withdraws and terminates DJOC.  Ct will enter conviction DE plead and matter will be scheduled for sentencing.  ADA requesting PSI report.  Atty Knaak no objection.  Ct orders PSI and to be filed by 1/22/21.  3:48 adj.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 5, 2021 at 03:00 pm.
